website_summaries.verdict: Worth considering if you prefer a knife-like design; plus the lifetime warranty adds to its value.
pros: Foldable model that can be operated with one hand
Has a safety pin and blade-locking technology for added security
Backed by the company's lifetime warranty
cons: Smaller than some customers anticipated, and some owners of previous Buck Knives products say the quality has declined somewhat

customer_reviews.title: Unenthused expected much more from a buck
customer_reviews.text: Honestly I expected a lot more from a buck knife I've had many in the past and really like them but lately I've been buying crkt. Finally took a shot in the dark and came back to a buck but I'm completely unenthused. The knife is awkward in your hand it's hard to get in and out of your pocket with the rubber grip and it's difficult to use fully one handed. Slow to open. Also the seatbelt cutter got caught on my pants which is never happened to me before with a rescue knife and cut my pocket. So I'm down a pair of pants and not happy with a almost $50 knife.
customer_reviews.author: mak1313

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised upon unboxing this knife, the black version actually looks very nice. Something about it makes it appealing, and it feels nice in hand. If you’re looking for a decent rescue knife that you wouldn’t mind beating up, this is the knife. You won’t be breaking the bank. All Buck knives come with a lifetime warranty anyways. Although the lock does feel very sturdy, there’s just a tiny bit of movement in the blade when it’s open.
customer_reviews.author: Sonny N.

customer_reviews.title: Great value but the seatbelt cutter is a minor weak spot.
customer_reviews.text: One of the best value rescue knives on the market. The safespin is unique, locks the blade shut, and, let's be honest, fun to fidget with. You can dial in the pivot screw such that you can fling the knife open and shut while pulling back the safety. The seat belt cutter works but nearly as well as others I've used. As with most knives of this style, the seat belt cutter would be next to impossible to resharpen. Not USA made.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: and for 30+ dollars I am happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: Started to use this today at work, and for 30+ dollars I am happy with my purchase. But, and for me this is a big but. I am 60 years old with a little arthritis in my hands, and I cannot push the lock and unlock button easily. It's actually very hard for me. I have worked the button up and down with the eraser on a pencil several hundred times hoping it will become smoother. Not there yet. I am going to spray a dry lubricant inside and see if that makes it better, I hope. Other than that - Great knife for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Nor

customer_reviews.title: No weight, lotta tool for the size, nice grip, good steel and edge retention
customer_reviews.text: love it, smaller than my other rescue knifes and the yellow rubber is grippy with a nice pocket clip to keep ready. Rubber seems to fade a bit but that's probably because of my pocket lint? Just cleaned with tooth brush and dish soap and color mostly comes back. Lock button was pain at first but this is not unfolding accidentally - you must positively pull button down first and then you can assist opening with the top of the blade on the round part. Was a pain at first but now I don't mind.
customer_reviews.author: Richard B.

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money but better rescue knives out there
customer_reviews.text: Seat belt cutter: darn good. Blade, opening, locking: good. Glass breaker: wimpy, poor position, an after thought at best. Handle/grip: awful. I really dislike the handle. Here is my main gripe, the rubberized handle is great when in hand, the problem is getting the knife from pocket carry to useable and ready. Imagine stuffing a slightly gummy, grippy, knife into your front jean pocket and walking around all day. It's also a little on the small side and I have pretty small hands for a guy. It's an ok knife, but not something I use or handle often. The handle issue makes this not possible for an every day carry item for me.
customer_reviews.author: Rew

customer_reviews.title: OK if you like a knife on the small side.
customer_reviews.text: Returned it, and got the SOG Rescue knife, this one was to small for me.
customer_reviews.author: Merlin Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Very useful knife because of its small size
customer_reviews.text: Very useful knife because of its small size, rubber coating, quick release and safety tools. Don't know if the seatbelt cutter or glass breaker works well but overall this knife is something that you keep with you all the time because of its small size, ease to open/close and its sharpness. I have it in my pocket and forget about it or leave it in the car so that whoever's driving has it if they need it (hopefully not). But when I do that I sometimes miss the knife because I thought I had it in my pocket but don't ... maybe I'll just buy another.
customer_reviews.author: MobyS

customer_reviews.title: Great knife
customer_reviews.text: Love the knife. I've had 3 of the same so far(2 with a bottle opener instead of seatbelt cutter). Rubberized grip is nice, safety lock works well. Knife comes very sharp from factory. Cant speak on how well the seat belt cutter works though.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Color not the same as pics
customer_reviews.text: The actual knife part of this knife is great, but it's not the same color as the pictures. It's way more dull and more brown like dijon mustard maybe. The pics are very misleading.
customer_reviews.author: N. Whipple

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking knife and appears to be of decent quality ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking knife and appears to be of decent quality even though it is stamped "China". I was surprised since I thought all Buck knives were USA made. The Only possible feature that may be a problem after constant use is the plastic release and lock switch. It appears to be fastened to a metal slide that allows the knife to open and lock and may break off or come loose after a while. Would have expected a more sturdy type metal switch and slide as one piece since it is a Buck and they are known for quality .
customer_reviews.author: Ricky D

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I only just got this but so far I love it. Unlike a lot of other inexpensive knives, it easily flicks open with one hand and has a deep pocket clip. I got this knife because I needed one with a glass breaker and this knife has an actual carbide glass breaker, not just a pointed metal tip. Also as others have said, the angled seatbelt cutter will cut better than a straight bladed cutter. All in all I am very satisfied with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: This is a great knife for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great knife for the price. I purchased it to wear when I am on duty as a volunteer EMT. I have not tried the seat belt cutter or window punch yet. The knife came very sharp out of the box which is nice. The belt clip is very tight and sturdy. Very easy to open using the thumb latch and finger wheel if you are right handed. I am left handed and it takes a little practice, but it can be done. The locking mechanism is very secure. I would highly recommend this knife for anyone needing a folding rescue or EMS type pocket knife.
customer_reviews.author: Hayes

customer_reviews.title: Buck Rocks!
customer_reviews.text: You would be hard pressed to convince me that Buck does not make the best all around knife out there. This one is no exception. Nice balance and feel. Holds edge very well and a quick to open feature. Good looking and functionality.
customer_reviews.author: j rocket

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: flimsy, rubber catches in pocket, not worthy of buck brand.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Louthan

customer_reviews.title: Great knife for EDC and rescue workers.
customer_reviews.text: Great knife. This has the glass breaker for rescue work, and a seat belt cutter. This is a good one to always carry with you, especially if you work in the rescue or medical field, or are a firefighter. The knife locks closed and locks open which is great. The outside is a tacky rubber for a nice grip. The knife has a good edge and is super sharp. Also very light weight. Just keep the closing mechanism lightly oiled, and it should last you years.
customer_reviews.author: Watch Collector

customer_reviews.title: Great Grip, quick release
customer_reviews.text: Great knife. Great rubber grip. Quick release of the blade with the red switch you see. Very ergonomic grip. There is also a seat belt cutter and a metal tip on the opposite end of the blade for breaking your car window in case of an emergency in the car. They come in different colors... so they are easy to find in a pile of stuff, and there is a clip on the backside so you can clip it to your belt/pants etc. Also comes in black too. Worth every penny! Great to keep in the car just in case of emergency.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: I bought this knife and got it and everything was better than I hoped
customer_reviews.text: I have mixed feelings here. I bought this knife and got it and everything was better than I hoped, but I lost the knife. I liked it so much I ordered another one. The second one came on time, but the blade was very tight, and would barely open. Plus, the clip was bent a little open, and the second or third day I had it, I noticed some surface rust on it. I was very happy with my first one, so it's five stars, but my second one was not up to standards, so it gets one star, so the average for the two is three stars.
customer_reviews.author: ruroken18

customer_reviews.title: Perfect knife!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this knife for my nephew and son for Christmas! They both love the knife. It is so well made. Extra features include the glass breaker and seatbelt cutter. I like the serated edge on the knife. It was such a hit at Christmas that several other members of the family want to order one for themselves. I guess you can say, I hit the mark with this gift.
customer_reviews.author: Angee Allen

customer_reviews.title: Good for Everyday
customer_reviews.text: This is my E.D.C (Every Day Carry) knife. I was sorry it wasn't American made but with the Buck lifetime guarantee I gave it a chance. It is a solid tool. I have used it for everything from opening boxes to cutting fruit and I am happy with it. It holds an edge pretty well and is east to sharpen. The blade lock is not what I was used to but I like that too. Instead of risking a cut using a Liner lock I can close (or open) with one hand. It is not an assisted open knife but that is not really an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Great small-blade rescue knife
customer_reviews.text: I needed a blade that was not over 2-3/4" and that is not easy to find in a rescue-style knife. This is a very good knife and carries the Buck lifetime guarantee, plus it is made in America. I would prefer a more typical thumb tab opening device over the finger wheel mechanism, but it has the added safety of the thumb release. I think it is unbeatable for a "legal" blade rescue knife.
customer_reviews.author: Vegas Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Great for infrequent use
customer_reviews.text: Somehow it's smaller than I expected, but is exactly as described... anyway, the only reason I don't rate this 5 stars, is because it has rivets instead of screws, so it can't be taken apart for maintenance, which means after repeated hard use, it will eventually no longer be safely operable. Also, it's not as brightly colored as pictured, but that's not a deal breaker. I imagine this would be a great little knife incase of emergencies, but not for everyday use.
customer_reviews.author: Sinel

customer_reviews.title: Love these knives!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect knife for edc. It is sharp right out of the box, easy to open and close and has the glass break and cutter. Do not hesitate to buy it, you will wind up carrying it every day.
customer_reviews.author: Guy

customer_reviews.title: Easy opening.
customer_reviews.text: Fast and easy one handed opening with a razor sharp blade. Light with a comfortable grip. Great value with a lifetime warranty.
customer_reviews.author: GMP

customer_reviews.title: Good simple first aid kit knife.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality knife for first aid kit to keep in car/truck. Opens/closes easy with one hand. Purchased for with to go in get home bag and like the non aggressive yellow color and fact that it does lock close for use around small children but still allow quick one hand opening. Would love to see made in USA. Instead of China but.. then it would prob. Be $40-60 and it's just going in first aid kit
customer_reviews.author: jason r pettitt

customer_reviews.title: It's a Buck knife, nuff said
customer_reviews.text: I collect knives and own several Bucks, but this one isn't going into the case it's going to work. China stamped on the blade took me by surprise but it still has Buck quality.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Buck comes through big
customer_reviews.text: I'm hugely impressed with this knife. One-handed open and close is smooth and easy. I was looking for something with all of these features that was a little smaller and lighter than what I had and this fit the bill perfectly. I use it for EDC, but I work in an office environment, so small and light is a plus. I love that the button locks it closed as well as open. It is really, REALLY sharp. The yellow, rubbery grip looks and feels great. ... I've bought 4 (!) knives in the past year looking for my "perfect" EDC. This was the last one and this is it.
customer_reviews.author: kace

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic knife. Incredibly easy to open and even close ...
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic knife. Incredibly easy to open and even close with one hand. Locking mechanism works great, very confident in it's ability to hold the blade open or closed when in use. Nice and sharp; cuts great so far! Highly recommend for general use/carry.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R.

customer_reviews.title: Nice and good quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for my husband. He loved it only probably is the hook kept catching on things and it was stolen from him.
customer_reviews.author: Angela M

customer_reviews.title: Great Knife
customer_reviews.text: Very solid knife, thought it was going to be heavy when I ordered it but it's pretty light for it's size. Easy to open with one hand and has a rubber grip that feels fine in the hand. It also comes with bucks forever warranty so it can be replaced if something breaks on it (unless there's sign of abuse).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great knife with the paracord cutter, especially for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great knife with the paracord cutter-type thing. Could be a bit better spring-assisted but it’s smooth coming in and going out. The serration could be a bit sharper but definitely gets the job done. Would order again.
customer_reviews.author: Kai Colucci

customer_reviews.title: and fits in the front pocket great. I am very pleased with my purchase and ...
customer_reviews.text: The name "Buck" says it all. The knife is extremely sharp, compact, and fits in the front pocket great. I am very pleased with my purchase and I wouldn't hesitate to buy another one if I were to loose my current one!
customer_reviews.author: Bensonboy

customer_reviews.title: Light, Versative and Essential
customer_reviews.text: One of my all time favorite pocket knives. Light, great clip, easy to open and close left or right handed. The seat belt cutting hook and windshield breaking stud make it a perfect piece to keep with me when traveling by car. Also like the tight lock-up "open or closed". Should probably buy at least another one if not 2 or 3 in case I lose mine. Already bought another for my EMT daughter.
customer_reviews.author: Robert C. Crosby

customer_reviews.title: Good to Have in the Car
customer_reviews.text: I have this in the center console of my car. In case of emergencies, I can either cut my seat belt and/or break the window. I bought this and two other Buck knives to leave in different locations.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Great lil knife to toss around in the truck or on piece of equipment. I don't much care for the seat belt cutter being exposed, but I knew this going in so not a knock on Buck. I love the rubber handle which is the only reason I chose this over the Flashpoint. I wish they would make the Flashpoint with the rubber handle and carabiner instead of the seatbelt cutter. All in all, good cheap knife.
customer_reviews.author: Bryce J Cox

customer_reviews.title: A glass breaker that works!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son for the glass breaker that actually works well and he is very happy with this knife that gets daily use and does not fall apart like most of the knives now days.
customer_reviews.author: Fredrick C.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice knife. The one thing I don't like about ...
customer_reviews.text: Very nice knife. The one thing I don't like about it is that you have to unlock the blade to open it. I prefer knives that you only unlock to close.
customer_reviews.author: BFH

customer_reviews.title: Seatbelt cutter isn’t all that sharp. It may work ...
customer_reviews.text: Seatbelt cutter isn’t all that sharp. It may work but I’m not sure. The rest of the knife is sharp and the mechanism works well. Lightweight but the grippy handle of the knife gets caught and stops against your clothes.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. P

customer_reviews.title: Very nice light weight knife
customer_reviews.text: So got the knife the other day and was immediately impressed. First off the handle is rubber not metal or plastic so you have a great grip. Next thing you notice is the weight, there isn't any. This is a very light knife. Blade is very sharp. Can't speak to the window break or seatbelt cutter yet. I don't know what the long term reliability of the knife will be but first impressions are very good.
customer_reviews.author: Dandy Tomczyk

customer_reviews.title: made in China
customer_reviews.text: knife works well I am a FF and I keep it in my coat, the only problem is it is the first Buck knife I ever owned that was made in China
customer_reviews.author: dfireman

customer_reviews.title: My Fav EDC Knife
customer_reviews.text: This is my EDC. I love everything about it! It's sharp, light, solid, practical. I would buy it again and I highly recommend it to others.
customer_reviews.author: billnotti

customer_reviews.title: Great company, quality knife!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great everyday carry pocket knife. It’s nice to have a glass break and seatbelt cutter in my pocket just in case they are needed one day. I’m 98% satisfied with it and if Buck can find away to make these blades in America I’ll be 100% satisfied. Either way I stand behind Buck because of what they stand for.
customer_reviews.author: CooperII

customer_reviews.title: Seeing as how i loved my buck knife i went to see what other ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this knife a few months ago as a daily carry knife as i have hound it to be a pain to carry my buck 110 knife with me as it is huge (great knife also). Seeing as how i loved my buck knife i went to see what other knives they have and found this. This was about 65 bucks on their site and 60 as the local gun shop. I hound it on here for about 35 dollars and ordered it immediately. It has been great ever since i got it, it keeps a sharp edge and is very sturdy. I highly recommend this knife to anyone looking for a quality knife.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: I bought two one for my husband one for my son. It is made in China (damnnn iiit)...My husband is a mold/model/toolmaker and he said it is a good knife (for the money). Not as sharp as the Leatherman little tool knife I bought my other son. That one is made in USA. This Buck is a pretty good knife.
customer_reviews.author: D.G.

customer_reviews.title: Rides in my pocket
customer_reviews.text: A nice pocket knife that has some utility in an emergency. Like one hand opening and blade lock. Fits my hand comfortably. Not sure the serrations are needed in my case. Have further honed the edge for even better performance on routine tasks.
customer_reviews.author: Alex M

customer_reviews.title: Cool little EDC knife
customer_reviews.text: Nice little folding knife as described. I use it as an EDC because it is compact and not too cumbersome.
customer_reviews.author: Julian J Bustamante

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Knife for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great all purpose pocket knife. It is both lightweight and durable. Extremely sharp edge. Excellent quality especially considering the price.
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: Super sharp
customer_reviews.text: Great knife and super sharp. Opens with a flick of the wrist.
customer_reviews.author: David Almcrantz

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: Was very disapointed. This knife does not have the typical buck quality, feel or weight wish I never would have spent money on it unless it came from a gumball machine.
customer_reviews.author: Justin kopta

customer_reviews.title: Good knives, wrong packaging
customer_reviews.text: I like these knives. I have another in blue that I wore out. They yellow is a really dull, orangey yellow, which was not what I was really expecting. My other issue is that I recieved the wrong one. I ordered the glassbreaker rescue version (which as an EMT was a key feature for me), and recieved the bottle opener despite the package reading otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding "Buck" quality - easy enough to open and close, and like the serrated blade for safety as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Great knife especially for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Great well made product for my son. Would highly recommend. Especially for he price. No one else comes close.
customer_reviews.author: Doron Krinetz

customer_reviews.title: Used to be sharp and break stuff easily not so anymore
customer_reviews.text: Had it for a year now. Lost of lot of its blade sharpness. Also Glass breaker point dulls from being exposed all the time. Used to be sharp and break stuff easily not so anymore.
customer_reviews.author: goodblack

customer_reviews.title: Nice inexpensive knife.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift and then hated to part with it. Lightweight but sturdy for an inexpensive knife. This model is made in China. Some Buck knives are made in USA
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: OK
customer_reviews.text: Small in the hand, hard to open, not as good as flashpoint model. Lightweight. MADE IN CHINA.
customer_reviews.author: Ken King

customer_reviews.title: BUCK RESUCE KNIFE MADE IN CHINA
customer_reviews.text: Overall I like the Buck Rescue Knife - the blade deploys very easy and it is much lighter than most. Overall I pleased with the knife except for one thing. That is I was disappointed to find that This Buck knife is made in China.
customer_reviews.author: Terry R. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Good knife for the money.
customer_reviews.text: It’s a nice knife. It’s sturdy and fits my hand well
customer_reviews.author: Jorge954

customer_reviews.title: Love it. Used it to break windows on a ...
customer_reviews.text: EMT. Love it. Used it to break windows on a rollover I responded to off duty. Seat belt cutter cuts through nearly anything. Blade is always of Buck quality.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Great knife.
customer_reviews.text: This is my EDC and it gets the job done while staying locked when it needs to be.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Best One-Handed Knife NO Assist/Spring
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this knife for almost 10 years m. There is nothing else like it!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Weldon

customer_reviews.title: ... the mail a few days ago and am very happy. This is replacing one I lost a few ...
customer_reviews.text: Just got it in the mail a few days ago and am very happy. This is replacing one I lost a few months ago and found I can't live without. The one I lost I had for over two years and never had a problem with it.
customer_reviews.author: Blackstone

customer_reviews.title: I like the secure locking of the knife
customer_reviews.text: I like the secure locking of the knife, both closed and in the open position. The unlock/opening feature takes some getting used to. It's lightweight and sharp.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell Lee

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: great knife as always, Love the Buck Knives, rugged and dependable, I own several and wouldn't have any other
customer_reviews.author: Larry  A

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: This is an improvement on the buck knife design I love and have used for years. I will be buying another one or two! Buck knives are everywhere but this particular design is hard to find in the stores
customer_reviews.author: Ukmc

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Knife
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good knife to have in the car with a good blade, a seatbelt cutter and glass break pommel... Sturdy build, compact, and very, very sharp serrated blade. Hopefully, it will not be needed for any emergencies, but it is good to have tools to be prepared. It seems to be a good quality folder.
customer_reviews.author: CulturalCoroner

customer_reviews.title: A+++++
customer_reviews.text: Another EXCELLENT knife from Buck. Razor sharp, well made (like all Buck knives), feels great in my hand, and made in America. I will be buying another soon. VERY HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.
customer_reviews.author: emfl

customer_reviews.title: Unsuitable for EDC
customer_reviews.text: 1. The belt-clip is at the wrong end of the knife and therefore requires additional handling before it can be used. 2. The glass-breaker is sharp (woo!) but presses into your hand even when you're opening the knife.
customer_reviews.author: TransGirlReviews

customer_reviews.title: Great knife
customer_reviews.text: Excellent EDC knife. Once you get used to how it opens, it becomes second nature and is very fast. The cutter comes in handy in so many ways. Would absolutely buy another if I ever lost this one.
customer_reviews.author: Roy

customer_reviews.title: High Quality
customer_reviews.text: good quality. Keep it in the car as an emergency tool.
customer_reviews.author: L J. Unruh

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: very sharp, keeps an edge. Got it for my son who's a firefighter.
customer_reviews.author: david e baker

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than I wanted.
customer_reviews.text: This knife was smaller and feels more plasticy than I thought it would. I have other Buck knives that I think are of higher quality.
customer_reviews.author: Randy W.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It's a great pocket knife that has possible life-saving attribute. Very handy and well made.
customer_reviews.author: Bob B

customer_reviews.title: i like this knife it opens fast
customer_reviews.text: i like this knife it opens fast.and closes fast if you want it to.i like the fact that it locks in open or closed mode.the more i open and close it the more i like it.good knife
customer_reviews.author: leonard eastman

customer_reviews.title: I love these Buck knives
customer_reviews.text: I love these Buck knives, the blade on this one is holding up better then other versions of this style I've had
customer_reviews.author: Elenorzx

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: Own several Buck knives. These one is just as good. Great quality.
customer_reviews.author: Naomi H.

customer_reviews.title: Great knife!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this knife for my husband. He loves it! Great features like the seatbelt cutter and glass breaker! Blade is quality!!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Theriot

customer_reviews.title: Solid knife at a good price point.
customer_reviews.text: Very sharp and good for what it is designed to do. Not for the professional rescue person as much as the individual who might use it. Feels goo in your hand, well balanced and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Brad | San Diego

customer_reviews.title: Great, little EDC.
customer_reviews.text: A wonderful EDC knife. Small, light, very sharp, excellent locking mechanism, and incredibly easy to open and close. I'm not a knife aficionado by any stretch of the imagination, but this piece is exactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: BC

customer_reviews.title: Best Knife
customer_reviews.text: This is the best knife I've ever owned. I won't ever buy another knife that isn't Buck. Very sharp out of the box but unfortunately I haven't had the opportunity to try out the glass breaker and seat belt cutter. Maybe someday ...
customer_reviews.author: GJ

customer_reviews.title: Feels great in the hand and the opening mechanism is awesome
customer_reviews.text: Bought this before but lost it. Immediate felt naked so bought a new one. Feels great in the hand and the opening mechanism is awesome. Everything is durable and ready for use.
customer_reviews.author: Mack

customer_reviews.title: It's a great knife. It feels sturdy and the blade stays ...
customer_reviews.text: It's a great knife. It feels sturdy and the blade stays locked inn place with the mechanism built into it. I often keep it in my car as it serves as an emergency tool for me.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Z.

customer_reviews.title: I had been looking for a reasonably priced, high ...
customer_reviews.text: I had been looking for a reasonably priced, high quality, rescue knife with a carbide window breaker. This Buck fits the bill.
customer_reviews.author: D. Johnston

customer_reviews.title: Husband loved it!
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift for my husband. He'd seen one similar to it at Cabela's that was all orange. All I new was he wanted a Buck knife with a seat belt cutter, and he LOVED this one. Said it was exactly what he wanted. He's a collector of sorts, so I'd say if he loved it, it's probably worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Mackenzie Fraley

customer_reviews.title: Excellent all purpose knife companion.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great knife. It is beautifully designed for maximum utility. I am impressed by the design, the safety features, and the quality of materials.
customer_reviews.author: John C. Fentress

customer_reviews.title: Another perfect Buck. I can't find anything wrong with it ...
customer_reviews.text: Another perfect Buck. I can't find anything wrong with it - and believe me I evaluate my knives carefully - if a design flaw is present - I'll find it.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Ramos

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great knife. Made in China assembled in USA or so they say.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: ... our volunteer ambulance staff and they were all very pleased to receive the knife
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift that was given top our volunteer ambulance staff and they were all very pleased to receive the knife.
customer_reviews.author: William Cowin

customer_reviews.title: As good as it looks!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent tool. Supremely sharp out of the box. The one finger roll open function and lock release mechanism is truly superb. A definite winner from Buck, don't hesitate to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: but she would be happy if I gave her a sack of rocks LoL
customer_reviews.text: It's a very small knife so I gave it to my honey she likes it okay but not for me, but she would be happy if I gave her a sack of rocks LoL..
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Corse

customer_reviews.title: Fast delivery
customer_reviews.text: Just as I expected my product to be! Couldn't be happier
customer_reviews.author: Alex Michael Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Sent to my son because I've never heard of a bad Buck.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son who works in the wilderness of Wyoming and surrounding states. I hope that he finds it useful.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Glenn Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great Knife
customer_reviews.text: I had a knife just like this one and lost it.. I had to get the exact one... It is so easy to open and close one handed without touching the blade... very sharp too..
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Awesome knife
customer_reviews.text: Awesome knife super sharp easy to open seems to be well made I think this knife will pass whatever you have need for.
customer_reviews.author: KP2000

customer_reviews.title: This Buck knife model is made in China NOT in the USA!
customer_reviews.text: When did Buck knives go to China? Little disappointing because I thought all Buck knives were made in the USA at the Idaho plant. Apparently 20% of their knives are made in China including this model. Other than that, I am very happy with the knife.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good daily knife
customer_reviews.text: Have had this knife for 3 years now. good everyday carry. the rubber handle has torn some from daily use.
customer_reviews.author: J.G.

customer_reviews.title: He's very happy with it
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my husband to carry when volunteer firefighting. He's very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn A.

customer_reviews.title: Great knife
customer_reviews.text: This is the best rescue knife I have seen. Solidly built, and the one-hand opener works very well. I recommend this knife.
customer_reviews.author: Randy P McCracken

customer_reviews.title: its a buck
customer_reviews.text: Not my everyday carry. I prefer a spring assist lie my Kershaw but this buck is super sharp out of the box
customer_reviews.author: Boot Strap

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great knife, use it for kayaking it opens really easy
customer_reviews.author: sheila shelton

customer_reviews.title: Buck knife
customer_reviews.text: Great price, features, feel and looks. Oh yea, the quality is first rate and the sharpest blade I've ever received.
customer_reviews.author: Julius Salinas

product_meta.title: Buck Knives 753 Redpoint Rescue Tactical Folding Knife Strap Cutter Glass Breaker
product_meta.description: The Redpoint is a great knife that can crossover in to many categories for multi-purpose use. The Redpoint Rescue has a reputation for safety and performance for those who serve and protect.
feature_bullets: ONE HAND OPEN AND CLOSE - The Safe-Spin deployment technology provides easy one hand opening and closing without having to touch the blade. The blade locks open or closed

SAFE AND SECURE GRIP – The Contoured All-Weather Handle with Rubber Overmold provide a comfortable and secure grip in any weather condition. The integrated tempered glass breaker and seatbelt cutter make this a great knife choice for emergency situations
FOREVER WARRANTY - Since 1902 Buck Knives has offered a lifetime warranty on our knives because we believe in the integrity of our products.

RAZOR SHARP BLADE - The 2-3/4" Partially Serrated Titanium Coated 420 HC Stainless Steel Blade with non-reflective coating delivers excellent strength, edge retention, and corrosion resistance. Closed Length 4-3/8" Weight 2.9 oz.
CONVENIENT CARRY - The large blade release button makes it easy to open the knife even with gloves on. The removable tip down, deep pocket carry clip makes your knife easily accessible
